messages.messageBody:
>I realized that egroups has a setting where only members of a list can
access
>the archives. Could we have this list set that way?
>
>:-) Diane


I DO believe that this list is set that way. But anyone can sign up and
then immediately read the archives.

Vicki

P.S.: don't go all paranoid. Pretty big task to read archives in
entirety :-). But do remember that at any time there may be more
listmembers lurking than the total you have seen posts from. So while
these communities can indeed be very supportive and one can make friends,
you must remember that the listeï¿½w[elf is pretty accessible to anyone
wanting to listen in.

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/9/00 9:19:11 AM US Mountain Standard Time,
earthmagik@... writes:

> P. S. I would feel somewhat violated if people could access totally
personal
> feelingsa such as these , on a search engine...after all this is somewhat
of
> a support group, and in these type sof groups it is in the spirit of the
> groups to assume soem degree of confidentiality. wouldn't you think? Not
> that it matters what someone might think that reads this, but it is rather
> personal..I should be able to choose to whom, I 'd like to share it with.

I realized that egroups has a setting where only members of a list can access
the archives. Could we have this list set that way?

:-) Diane
